payload.content: Openclaw (formerly Moltbot) is genuinely impressive, evidenced by 100K+ GitHub stars and praise from Andrej Karpathy, making it one of the fastest-growing open-source projects in history.

name: Openclaw (formerly Moltbot) is genuinely impressive, evidenced by 100K+ GitHub s
content: Openclaw (formerly Moltbot) is genuinely impressive, evidenced by 100K+ GitHub stars and praise from Andrej Karpathy, making it one of the fastest-growing open-source projects in history.

payload.content: Openclaw excels at execution, integrating with messaging apps, sending emails, moving files, controlling browsers, running shell commands, and proactively messaging users.

name: Openclaw excels at execution, integrating with messaging apps, sending emails, m
content: Openclaw excels at execution, integrating with messaging apps, sending emails, moving files, controlling browsers, running shell commands, and proactively messaging users.

payload.content: Openclaw lacks a visual interface for designing agents, a marketplace for pre-built skills, knowledge base management, multi-agent collaboration, artifact rendering, text-to-image generation, and branching conversations.

name: Openclaw lacks a visual interface for designing agents, a marketplace for pre-bu
content: Openclaw lacks a visual interface for designing agents, a marketplace for pre-built skills, knowledge base management, multi-agent collaboration, artifact rendering, text-to-image generation, and branching conversations.

payload.content: Openclaw is like 'the hands' for AI operations, implying it handles execution but requires a 'brain' for higher-level functions.

name: Openclaw is like 'the hands' for AI operations, implying it handles execution bu
content: Openclaw is like 'the hands' for AI operations, implying it handles execution but requires a 'brain' for higher-level functions.

payload.content: LobeHub is defined as an infrastructure for building, managing, and deploying AI agents with a proper interface, designed for finding, building, and collaborating with agent teammates that grow with the user.

name: LobeHub is defined as an infrastructure for building, managing, and deploying AI
content: LobeHub is defined as an infrastructure for building, managing, and deploying AI agents with a proper interface, designed for finding, building, and collaborating with agent teammates that grow with the user.

payload.content: LobeHub and Openclaw are complementary, with LobeHub solving Openclaw's deficiencies (agent groups, visual interface, knowledge bases, multi-model routing, artifact rendering, personal memory, scheduling) and Openclaw addressing LobeHub's gaps (24/7 execution, messaging app integration, proactive notifications, shell access, always-on presence, but only single agents).

name: LobeHub and Openclaw are complementary, with LobeHub solving Openclaw's deficien
content: LobeHub and Openclaw are complementary, with LobeHub solving Openclaw's deficiencies (agent groups, visual interface, knowledge bases, multi-model routing, artifact rendering, personal memory, scheduling) and Openclaw addressing LobeHub's gaps (24/7 execution, messaging app integration, proactive notifications, shell access, always-on presence, but only single agents).

payload.content: Sophisticated agents can be designed in LobeHub and then deployed to operate in a user's pocket via Openclaw.

name: Sophisticated agents can be designed in LobeHub and then deployed to operate in
content: Sophisticated agents can be designed in LobeHub and then deployed to operate in a user's pocket via Openclaw.

payload.content: Agent Groups in LobeHub enable multiple specialized agents to collaborate within the same conversation, with a built-in supervisor determining speaking order.

name: Agent Groups in LobeHub enable multiple specialized agents to collaborate within
content: Agent Groups in LobeHub enable multiple specialized agents to collaborate within the same conversation, with a built-in supervisor determining speaking order.

payload.content: To leverage LobeHub's multi-agent capabilities with Openclaw, design a complex multi-agent workflow in LobeHub, refine it, then export the configuration and port the best agent's personality to Openclaw's SOUL.md file.

name: To leverage LobeHub's multi-agent capabilities with Openclaw, design a complex m
content: To leverage LobeHub's multi-agent capabilities with Openclaw, design a complex multi-agent workflow in LobeHub, refine it, then export the configuration and port the best agent's personality to Openclaw's SOUL.md file.

payload.content: LobeHub allows routing different tasks to different AI models (e.g., Claude for reasoning, GPT-4 for coding, Deepseek for cost-effectiveness, Gemini for multimodal, Ollama for privacy) within the same conversation based on user-defined rules.

name: LobeHub allows routing different tasks to different AI models (e.g., Claude for
content: LobeHub allows routing different tasks to different AI models (e.g., Claude for reasoning, GPT-4 for coding, Deepseek for cost-effectiveness, Gemini for multimodal, Ollama for privacy) within the same conversation based on user-defined rules.

payload.content: LobeHub's built-in RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) allows users to upload documents (PDFs, Word files, text), which LobeHub chunks, embeds, and stores in a vector database (PostgreSQL with pgvector) for agents to automatically search and retrieve relevant context.

name: LobeHub's built-in RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) allows users to upload d
content: LobeHub's built-in RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) allows users to upload documents (PDFs, Word files, text), which LobeHub chunks, embeds, and stores in a vector database (PostgreSQL with pgvector) for agents to automatically search and retrieve relevant context.

payload.content: By setting up LobeHub's knowledge base and connecting it via MCP, an Openclaw Telegram assistant can gain access to all company documents.

name: By setting up LobeHub's knowledge base and connecting it via MCP, an Openclaw Te
content: By setting up LobeHub's knowledge base and connecting it via MCP, an Openclaw Telegram assistant can gain access to all company documents.

payload.content: The technical stack for LobeHub's RAG includes LobeHub for document ingestion and embedding, PostgreSQL for vector storage, S3-compatible storage for original files, and an MCP server to expose the knowledge base for Openclaw queries.

name: The technical stack for LobeHub's RAG includes LobeHub for document ingestion an
content: The technical stack for LobeHub's RAG includes LobeHub for document ingestion and embedding, PostgreSQL for vector storage, S3-compatible storage for original files, and an MCP server to expose the knowledge base for Openclaw queries.

payload.content: LobeHub offers full text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-text (STT) integration with multiple providers like OpenAI Audio and Microsoft Edge Speech, allowing for prototyping voice-related applications that can then be deployed to Openclaw.

name: LobeHub offers full text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-text (STT) integration wi
content: LobeHub offers full text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-text (STT) integration with multiple providers like OpenAI Audio and Microsoft Edge Speech, allowing for prototyping voice-related applications that can then be deployed to Openclaw.

payload.content: Users can generate images mid-conversation with agents in LobeHub using DALL-E 3, MidJourney (via WebUI), and Pollinations, and then connect an image generation agent in LobeHub to Openclaw via MCP to enable text-to-image generation directly from messaging apps.

name: Users can generate images mid-conversation with agents in LobeHub using DALL-E 3
content: Users can generate images mid-conversation with agents in LobeHub using DALL-E 3, MidJourney (via WebUI), and Pollinations, and then connect an image generation agent in LobeHub to Openclaw via MCP to enable text-to-image generation directly from messaging apps.

payload.content: LobeHub supports vision models (GPT-4 Vision, Claude's vision, Gemini's multimodal), allowing agents to analyze images dragged into chat, which can be combined with Openclaw's ability to receive images via messaging apps to create a visual analysis pipeline.

name: LobeHub supports vision models (GPT-4 Vision, Claude's vision, Gemini's multimod
content: LobeHub supports vision models (GPT-4 Vision, Claude's vision, Gemini's multimodal), allowing agents to analyze images dragged into chat, which can be combined with Openclaw's ability to receive images via messaging apps to create a visual analysis pipeline.

payload.content: LobeHub renders artifacts like code blocks and documents, which aids in iteration and validation of agent output before deploying workflows to Openclaw, which outputs plain text.

name: LobeHub renders artifacts like code blocks and documents, which aids in iteratio
content: LobeHub renders artifacts like code blocks and documents, which aids in iteration and validation of agent output before deploying workflows to Openclaw, which outputs plain text.

payload.content: LobeHub enables branching conversations, allowing users to fork any conversation to explore different approaches and test multiple prompt variations simultaneously without losing context, which is invaluable for agent development.

name: LobeHub enables branching conversations, allowing users to fork any conversation
content: LobeHub enables branching conversations, allowing users to fork any conversation to explore different approaches and test multiple prompt variations simultaneously without losing context, which is invaluable for agent development.

payload.content: To use LobeHub's agent marketplace, find an agent that fulfills approximately 80% of your needs, customize the remaining 20%, and then port it to OpenClaw.

name: To use LobeHub's agent marketplace, find an agent that fulfills approximately 80
content: To use LobeHub's agent marketplace, find an agent that fulfills approximately 80% of your needs, customize the remaining 20%, and then port it to OpenClaw.

payload.content: LobeHub offers a marketplace of pre-built agents (e.g., academic writing assistants, code reviewers) that can be imported with one click, customized, and then ported to Openclaw, benefiting non-technical users by reducing the need to write prompts from scratch.

name: LobeHub offers a marketplace of pre-built agents (e.g., academic writing assista
content: LobeHub offers a marketplace of pre-built agents (e.g., academic writing assistants, code reviewers) that can be imported with one click, customized, and then ported to Openclaw, benefiting non-technical users by reducing the need to write prompts from scratch.

payload.content: LobeHub and OpenClaw both support the MCP (Multi-tool Communication Protocol) marketplace, enabling shared capabilities between them.

name: LobeHub and OpenClaw both support the MCP (Multi-tool Communication Protocol) ma
content: LobeHub and OpenClaw both support the MCP (Multi-tool Communication Protocol) marketplace, enabling shared capabilities between them.

payload.content: LobeHub's MCP marketplace provides over 10,000 plugins (e.g., database connections, web scraping, browser automation, code execution, Blender integration) that can be installed with one click, and by connecting the same MCP servers to both LobeHub and Openclaw, they can share capabilities.

name: LobeHub's MCP marketplace provides over 10,000 plugins (e.g., database connectio
content: LobeHub's MCP marketplace provides over 10,000 plugins (e.g., database connections, web scraping, browser automation, code execution, Blender integration) that can be installed with one click, and by connecting the same MCP servers to both LobeHub and Openclaw, they can share capabilities.

payload.content: To achieve shared capabilities between LobeHub and OpenClaw, connect the same MCP servers to both platforms.

name: To achieve shared capabilities between LobeHub and OpenClaw, connect the same MC
content: To achieve shared capabilities between LobeHub and OpenClaw, connect the same MCP servers to both platforms.

payload.content: LobeHub has native Ollama integration, allowing users to run completely private AI models locally with no API costs using a single Docker command.

name: LobeHub has native Ollama integration, allowing users to run completely private
content: LobeHub has native Ollama integration, allowing users to run completely private AI models locally with no API costs using a single Docker command.

payload.content: LobeHub offers native integration with Ollama, allowing users to run private AI models locally without API costs.

name: LobeHub offers native integration with Ollama, allowing users to run private AI
content: LobeHub offers native integration with Ollama, allowing users to run private AI models locally without API costs.

payload.content: To run LobeHub with Ollama for local models, use the Docker command: `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e OLLAMA_PROXY_URL=http://host.docker.internal:11434 lobehub/lobe-chat` after starting Ollama.

name: To run LobeHub with Ollama for local models, use the Docker command: `docker run
content: To run LobeHub with Ollama for local models, use the Docker command: `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e OLLAMA_PROXY_URL=http://host.docker.internal:11434 lobehub/lobe-chat` after starting Ollama.

payload.content: LobeHub provides a dedicated desktop application with better performance and resource management compared to its web-based version.

name: LobeHub provides a dedicated desktop application with better performance and res
content: LobeHub provides a dedicated desktop application with better performance and resource management compared to its web-based version.

payload.content: LobeHub offers flexible deployment options including Vercel, Docker, Railway, Netlify, and others, along with various authentication methods like Clerk, Auth0, and GitHub.

name: LobeHub offers flexible deployment options including Vercel, Docker, Railway, Ne
content: LobeHub offers flexible deployment options including Vercel, Docker, Railway, Netlify, and others, along with various authentication methods like Clerk, Auth0, and GitHub.

payload.content: LobeHub is available as a Progressive Web App (PWA), making it accessible on mobile devices.

name: LobeHub is available as a Progressive Web App (PWA), making it accessible on mob
content: LobeHub is available as a Progressive Web App (PWA), making it accessible on mobile devices.

payload.content: To deploy LobeHub on Vercel, fork the `lobehub/lobe-chat` repository, import it into Vercel, and add `OPENAI_API_KEY` and `ACCESS_CODE` as environment variables.

name: To deploy LobeHub on Vercel, fork the `lobehub/lobe-chat` repository, import it
content: To deploy LobeHub on Vercel, fork the `lobehub/lobe-chat` repository, import it into Vercel, and add `OPENAI_API_KEY` and `ACCESS_CODE` as environment variables.

payload.content: To deploy LobeHub using Docker, run the command: `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e OPENAI_API_KEY=your-key -e ACCESS_CODE=your-password lobehub/lobe-chat`.

name: To deploy LobeHub using Docker, run the command: `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e
content: To deploy LobeHub using Docker, run the command: `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e OPENAI_API_KEY=your-key -e ACCESS_CODE=your-password lobehub/lobe-chat`.

payload.content: To deploy LobeHub with Ollama for local models, first start Ollama with `docker run -d -v ollama:/root/.ollama -e OLLAMA_ORIGINS="*" -p 11434:11434 --name ollama ollama/ollama`, then run LobeChat pointing to Ollama with `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e OLLAMA_PROXY_URL=http://host.docker.internal:11434 lobehub/lobe-chat`.

name: To deploy LobeHub with Ollama for local models, first start Ollama with `docker
content: To deploy LobeHub with Ollama for local models, first start Ollama with `docker run -d -v ollama:/root/.ollama -e OLLAMA_ORIGINS="*" -p 11434:11434 --name ollama ollama/ollama`, then run LobeChat pointing to Ollama with `docker run -d -p 3210:3210 -e OLLAMA_PROXY_URL=http://host.docker.internal:11434 lobehub/lobe-chat`.

payload.content: To configure LobeHub, add your model providers (e.g., Anthropic, OpenAI) in the settings.

name: To configure LobeHub, add your model providers (e.g., Anthropic, OpenAI) in the
content: To configure LobeHub, add your model providers (e.g., Anthropic, OpenAI) in the settings.

payload.content: To set up a knowledge base in self-hosted LobeHub, you need PostgreSQL with pgvector extension, S3-compatible storage, and embedding API access.

name: To set up a knowledge base in self-hosted LobeHub, you need PostgreSQL with pgve
content: To set up a knowledge base in self-hosted LobeHub, you need PostgreSQL with pgvector extension, S3-compatible storage, and embedding API access.

payload.content: To install MCP plugins in LobeHub, go to the MCP marketplace and install relevant tools like web search (Brave or Perplexity) or Firecrawl.

name: To install MCP plugins in LobeHub, go to the MCP marketplace and install relevan
content: To install MCP plugins in LobeHub, go to the MCP marketplace and install relevant tools like web search (Brave or Perplexity) or Firecrawl.

payload.content: To create an agent in LobeHub, use the agent builder or import from the marketplace, then configure its system prompt, model selection, enabled tools/plugins, and knowledge base access.

name: To create an agent in LobeHub, use the agent builder or import from the marketpl
content: To create an agent in LobeHub, use the agent builder or import from the marketplace, then configure its system prompt, model selection, enabled tools/plugins, and knowledge base access.

payload.content: To connect LobeHub and OpenClaw via MCP, identify shared MCP servers, configure OpenClaw's MCP to include them, and verify both systems can access the same tools.

name: To connect LobeHub and OpenClaw via MCP, identify shared MCP servers, configure
content: To connect LobeHub and OpenClaw via MCP, identify shared MCP servers, configure OpenClaw's MCP to include them, and verify both systems can access the same tools.

payload.content: To sync personalities between LobeHub and OpenClaw, copy your best agent prompt from LobeHub into OpenClaw's SOUL.md file (e.g., `~/.openclaw/SOUL.md`).

name: To sync personalities between LobeHub and OpenClaw, copy your best agent prompt
content: To sync personalities between LobeHub and OpenClaw, copy your best agent prompt from LobeHub into OpenClaw's SOUL.md file (e.g., `~/.openclaw/SOUL.md`).

payload.content: To create a research pipeline, configure a research agent in LobeHub with web search, knowledge base access, and citation requirements, refine its prompt, add the same MCP servers to OpenClaw, and port the system prompt to SOUL.md.

name: To create a research pipeline, configure a research agent in LobeHub with web se
content: To create a research pipeline, configure a research agent in LobeHub with web search, knowledge base access, and citation requirements, refine its prompt, add the same MCP servers to OpenClaw, and port the system prompt to SOUL.md.

payload.content: To establish a content creation workflow, set up an agent team in LobeHub (research, writing, editor), test multi-agent collaboration, identify the best single-agent distillation of the workflow, and port it to OpenClaw.

name: To establish a content creation workflow, set up an agent team in LobeHub (resea
content: To establish a content creation workflow, set up an agent team in LobeHub (research, writing, editor), test multi-agent collaboration, identify the best single-agent distillation of the workflow, and port it to OpenClaw.

payload.content: To enable visual analysis, configure vision model access in LobeHub, create an agent to analyze images and extract information, test it, and connect OpenClaw to the same vision-capable model.

name: To enable visual analysis, configure vision model access in LobeHub, create an a
content: To enable visual analysis, configure vision model access in LobeHub, create an agent to analyze images and extract information, test it, and connect OpenClaw to the same vision-capable model.

payload.content: LobeChat Cloud offers a free tier with 500,000 credits and paid plans for heavy users.

name: LobeChat Cloud offers a free tier with 500,000 credits and paid plans for heavy
content: LobeChat Cloud offers a free tier with 500,000 credits and paid plans for heavy users.

payload.content: Self-hosting LobeHub on Vercel is typically free, or it can cost $5-20/month for a VPS with Docker, plus pass-through API costs.

name: Self-hosting LobeHub on Vercel is typically free, or it can cost $5-20/month for
content: Self-hosting LobeHub on Vercel is typically free, or it can cost $5-20/month for a VPS with Docker, plus pass-through API costs.

payload.content: To configure a vision model in LobeHub, create an agent that analyzes images and extracts key information, then test it with various image types. Connect OpenClaw to the same vision-capable model.

name: To configure a vision model in LobeHub, create an agent that analyzes images and
content: To configure a vision model in LobeHub, create an agent that analyzes images and extracts key information, then test it with various image types. Connect OpenClaw to the same vision-capable model.

payload.content: OpenClaw costs approximately $5/month for a VPS (e.g., Hetzner) and $20/month for Claude Pro or API costs, leading to a realistic monthly cost of $30-100 depending on usage.

name: OpenClaw costs approximately $5/month for a VPS (e.g., Hetzner) and $20/month fo
content: OpenClaw costs approximately $5/month for a VPS (e.g., Hetzner) and $20/month for Claude Pro or API costs, leading to a realistic monthly cost of $30-100 depending on usage.

payload.content: LobeHub offers a free tier with 500,000 credits and paid plans for heavy users, or can be self-hosted on Vercel's free tier or a $5-20/month VPS, with API costs passed through to providers.

name: LobeHub offers a free tier with 500,000 credits and paid plans for heavy users,
content: LobeHub offers a free tier with 500,000 credits and paid plans for heavy users, or can be self-hosted on Vercel's free tier or a $5-20/month VPS, with API costs passed through to providers.

payload.content: OpenClaw costs approximately $5/month for a VPS and $20/month for Claude Pro (or API costs), leading to a realistic monthly expenditure of $30-100 depending on usage.

name: OpenClaw costs approximately $5/month for a VPS and $20/month for Claude Pro (or
content: OpenClaw costs approximately $5/month for a VPS and $20/month for Claude Pro (or API costs), leading to a realistic monthly expenditure of $30-100 depending on usage.

payload.content: A combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack costs $25-50/month for low usage, $50-100/month for moderate usage, and $100-200/month for heavy usage.

name: A combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack costs $25-50/month for low usage, $50-100/
content: A combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack costs $25-50/month for low usage, $50-100/month for moderate usage, and $100-200/month for heavy usage.

payload.content: The combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack is significantly cheaper than a human VA ($500-2000/month) or enterprise AI platforms ($100-500/month per seat).

name: The combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack is significantly cheaper than a human VA
content: The combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack is significantly cheaper than a human VA ($500-2000/month) or enterprise AI platforms ($100-500/month per seat).

payload.content: Running two systems like LobeHub and OpenClaw increases the overall attack surface.

name: Running two systems like LobeHub and OpenClaw increases the overall attack surfa
content: Running two systems like LobeHub and OpenClaw increases the overall attack surface.

payload.content: To secure LobeHub, use an ACCESS_CODE environment variable, put self-hosted instances behind authentication (e.g., Cloudflare Zero Trust), avoid exposing it to the public internet without authentication, and be cautious about documents uploaded to knowledge bases.

name: To secure LobeHub, use an ACCESS_CODE environment variable, put self-hosted inst
content: To secure LobeHub, use an ACCESS_CODE environment variable, put self-hosted instances behind authentication (e.g., Cloudflare Zero Trust), avoid exposing it to the public internet without authentication, and be cautious about documents uploaded to knowledge bases.

payload.content: To secure OpenClaw, enable sandbox mode, run a security audit before deployment, explicitly whitelist commands, scope API tokens to minimum permissions, and never add it to group chats.

name: To secure OpenClaw, enable sandbox mode, run a security audit before deployment,
content: To secure OpenClaw, enable sandbox mode, run a security audit before deployment, explicitly whitelist commands, scope API tokens to minimum permissions, and never add it to group chats.

payload.content: If a Multi-Channel Proxy (MCP) server is compromised, both LobeHub and OpenClaw are affected because MCP servers run with the permissions granted to them.

name: If a Multi-Channel Proxy (MCP) server is compromised, both LobeHub and OpenClaw
content: If a Multi-Channel Proxy (MCP) server is compromised, both LobeHub and OpenClaw are affected because MCP servers run with the permissions granted to them.

payload.content: To secure MCP servers, only install them from trusted sources and review what each server can access.

name: To secure MCP servers, only install them from trusted sources and review what ea
content: To secure MCP servers, only install them from trusted sources and review what each server can access.

payload.content: For sensitive data, consider using local models via Ollama (to avoid API calls), self-hosting everything (to avoid cloud services), and encrypting knowledge bases at rest.

name: For sensitive data, consider using local models via Ollama (to avoid API calls),
content: For sensitive data, consider using local models via Ollama (to avoid API calls), self-hosting everything (to avoid cloud services), and encrypting knowledge bases at rest.

payload.content: Do not use the LobeHub and OpenClaw stack if OpenClaw alone is sufficient for your needs, as adding LobeHub introduces unnecessary complexity.

name: Do not use the LobeHub and OpenClaw stack if OpenClaw alone is sufficient for yo
content: Do not use the LobeHub and OpenClaw stack if OpenClaw alone is sufficient for your needs, as adding LobeHub introduces unnecessary complexity.

payload.content: This stack is not suitable for users who are only chatting with AI, as it is designed for building workflows rather than simple conversations.

name: This stack is not suitable for users who are only chatting with AI, as it is des
content: This stack is not suitable for users who are only chatting with AI, as it is designed for building workflows rather than simple conversations.

payload.content: Avoid this stack if you are uncomfortable managing two systems, as it doubles the maintenance burden compared to OpenClaw alone.

name: Avoid this stack if you are uncomfortable managing two systems, as it doubles th
content: Avoid this stack if you are uncomfortable managing two systems, as it doubles the maintenance burden compared to OpenClaw alone.

payload.content: This stack is not recommended for businesses requiring enterprise support or SLAs, as both LobeHub and OpenClaw are open-source projects without dedicated support teams.

name: This stack is not recommended for businesses requiring enterprise support or SLA
content: This stack is not recommended for businesses requiring enterprise support or SLAs, as both LobeHub and OpenClaw are open-source projects without dedicated support teams.

payload.content: Do not use this stack for simple use cases like setting reminders, as it is over-engineered for such tasks.

name: Do not use this stack for simple use cases like setting reminders, as it is over
content: Do not use this stack for simple use cases like setting reminders, as it is over-engineered for such tasks.

payload.content: This stack is suitable for building sophisticated agent workflows, needing knowledge base/RAG capabilities, requiring multi-model routing, iterating on prompts with a visual interface, desiring 24/7 execution, and being comfortable managing infrastructure.

name: This stack is suitable for building sophisticated agent workflows, needing knowl
content: This stack is suitable for building sophisticated agent workflows, needing knowledge base/RAG capabilities, requiring multi-model routing, iterating on prompts with a visual interface, desiring 24/7 execution, and being comfortable managing infrastructure.

payload.content: If an MCP server works in LobeHub but not OpenClaw, use absolute paths in OpenClaw's MCP config and verify environment variables are set, as different environments have different path configurations.

name: If an MCP server works in LobeHub but not OpenClaw, use absolute paths in OpenCl
content: If an MCP server works in LobeHub but not OpenClaw, use absolute paths in OpenClaw's MCP config and verify environment variables are set, as different environments have different path configurations.

payload.content: If knowledge base queries return nothing in OpenClaw, verify the DATABASE_URL is correct and ensure the embedding model in OpenClaw's MCP config matches LobeHub's configuration, as this indicates an embedding model mismatch or database connection issue.

name: If knowledge base queries return nothing in OpenClaw, verify the DATABASE_URL is
content: If knowledge base queries return nothing in OpenClaw, verify the DATABASE_URL is correct and ensure the embedding model in OpenClaw's MCP config matches LobeHub's configuration, as this indicates an embedding model mismatch or database connection issue.

payload.content: To fix LobeHub's inability to connect to Ollama, set OLLAMA_ORIGINS="*" and OLLAMA_HOST="0.0.0.0" before starting Ollama, because Ollama defaults to localhost only.

name: To fix LobeHub's inability to connect to Ollama, set OLLAMA_ORIGINS="*" and OLLA
content: To fix LobeHub's inability to connect to Ollama, set OLLAMA_ORIGINS="*" and OLLAMA_HOST="0.0.0.0" before starting Ollama, because Ollama defaults to localhost only.

payload.content: If an agent behaves differently in OpenClaw versus LobeHub, copy the complete system prompt from LobeHub agent settings and verify both use the same model version, as the SOUL.md might not be updated or model versions differ.

name: If an agent behaves differently in OpenClaw versus LobeHub, copy the complete sy
content: If an agent behaves differently in OpenClaw versus LobeHub, copy the complete system prompt from LobeHub agent settings and verify both use the same model version, as the SOUL.md might not be updated or model versions differ.

payload.content: To address faster-than-expected rate limits when running LobeHub and OpenClaw, use local models for testing, reserve API calls for production queries, and implement caching if supported, as running two systems roughly doubles API calls.

name: To address faster-than-expected rate limits when running LobeHub and OpenClaw, u
content: To address faster-than-expected rate limits when running LobeHub and OpenClaw, use local models for testing, reserve API calls for production queries, and implement caching if supported, as running two systems roughly doubles API calls.

payload.content: The future of personal AI is an ecosystem, not a single application, comprising components like LobeHub for design/testing/knowledge management, OpenClaw for 24/7 execution/messaging, MCP for shared capabilities, and local models for privacy/cost control.

name: The future of personal AI is an ecosystem, not a single application, comprising
content: The future of personal AI is an ecosystem, not a single application, comprising components like LobeHub for design/testing/knowledge management, OpenClaw for 24/7 execution/messaging, MCP for shared capabilities, and local models for privacy/cost control.

payload.content: LobeHub and OpenClaw, when combined, offer capabilities neither can achieve alone, such as sophisticated, multi-modal, and knowledge-aware AI assistants.

name: LobeHub and OpenClaw, when combined, offer capabilities neither can achieve alon
content: LobeHub and OpenClaw, when combined, offer capabilities neither can achieve alone, such as sophisticated, multi-modal, and knowledge-aware AI assistants.

payload.content: Combining LobeHub and OpenClaw introduces increased complexity, maintenance, and potential failure points.

name: Combining LobeHub and OpenClaw introduces increased complexity, maintenance, and
content: Combining LobeHub and OpenClaw introduces increased complexity, maintenance, and potential failure points.

payload.content: If the combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack is too complex, start with OpenClaw alone and add LobeHub later when its capabilities are needed.

name: If the combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack is too complex, start with OpenClaw a
content: If the combined LobeHub and OpenClaw stack is too complex, start with OpenClaw alone and add LobeHub later when its capabilities are needed.
